newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Minimal movement in shares.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Minimal movement in shares.

text.p: Few stocks were moving in the after-hours market and those that moved did not move much, traders said Tuesday.
SCI Systems was up a fraction at 80 from an unofficial close of 79-5/16 after announcing fourth quarter results and a two-for-one stock split.
Oak Technology traded at 11-11/16, near its unofficial close of 11-3/4, after reporting a fourth quarter profit of $0.06 a share, against a loss of $0.41 a share in the year-ago quarter.
"It's in line (with the close)," one trader said.
Symantec gained to 21-1/2, after closing down 1 on the day at 21-3/8. The company reported a first quarter profit of $0.32 a share, $0.02 above Wall Street estimates.

Microsoft shares also gained, rising to 140-1/2, up from a 139-15/16 close. The Federal Trade Commission said it would not investigate the company because a probe would duplicate U.S. Justice Department efforts.
Ascend shares rose to 53-5/8 from a close of 53-1/16, and those of Netscape were at 37-3/4, up from a close of 37-5/8.
Dealers said they were waiting for possible movement in Yahoo, whose shares were halted after the close.
The company's shares closed Tuesday up 11/16 at 48-1/4.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one had volume of 3,200, compared to 500 Monday. Session two had volume of nearly 4.5 million, compared to 3.2 million Monday.
